p: Research on individual genes cannot provide enough information to unravel the molecular mechanisms of stress resistance, which led us to conduct a natural laboratory experiment investigating the multigenic responses of mangrove plants immersed in their natural habitat. Through the presentation of a genetic correlation network obtained by examining the de novo transcriptome of R. mangle L., we described the patterns of gene expression in subpopulations located in the equatorial (Par√° State) and subtropical (Santa Catarina State) regions of Brazil. The two populations of mangrove trees showed divergent networks of co-expressed genes, with transcripts clustered into two main sets. Inferences regarding the threat of climate change to each local population are discussed here.
